alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 3:41AM PST until February 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow showers expected above 1500 feet. Additional accumulations of up to an inch expected. Cold temperatures below 32 degrees could allow black ice to form on any wet roads this morning. * WHERE...Elevations above 1500 feet in Western Siskiyou County and Central Siskiyou County. This includes portions of Interstate 5 north of Yreka as well as portions of Highway 96 from the junction with Interstate 5 to near Somes Bar. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel this morning could be difficult due to slick, snow or ice covered roads. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
